chapters.title: Chapter 1: The Beginning
chapters.content:
Artificial Intelligence began not with a bang, but with a whisper of code. In the early days, simple algorithms paved the way for the complex neural networks we see today...

As we moved into the 21st century, compute power exploded, allowing us to train models on vast datasets previously unimaginable.

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Machine Learning
chapters.content:
Machine Learning represents a paradigm shift. Instead of explicitly programming rules, we feed data to algorithms and let them discern the patterns.

Supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning are the three pillars of this new era.

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Ethical Considerations
chapters.content: With great power comes great responsibility. The ethical implications of AI are vast. From bias in algorithms to the displacement of jobs, we must navigate these waters carefully.
